header.type: 1 B PLAATJIES, HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: We are now going to ask our next witness, Mrs Buyelwa Plaatjies.  Thank you very much Mrs Plaatjies, Ms Maya will facilitate your evidence.
Thank you very much Mr Chairperson.  Mrs Plaatjies, I would like to ask you, what is your surname, is it Plaatjie, or Plaatjies?

In the statement before us on which your evidence today will be based we find that you are going to speak about Phumzile Gladwell Plaatjies, who was also part of the crowd of the people who was killed on 21 March 1985.  I would like you to please tell us when did you hear that Phumzile was no longer alive?  I would like you to tell us how his death affected you.
We heard on the Sunday that Phumzile had passed away.

We were told by a friend of his that was there.
UITENHAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
2 B PLAATJIES
How old was Phumzile at the time?
Was he still a pupil at the time?
Yes he was still at school.
After having heard that he had passed away, what did you do?
We went to look for him.  We came to AVBOB here and we were told to look for him in New Brighton.  We found him there.
After how long did you find him?
We found him after a week.
Were you called, when the other people were called to the Jubilee Hotel?
Who did you find there, and what was done, what was said to you at the Jubilee Hotel?
There were a lot of people there and there were attorneys present as well.  There were many of us and there were attorneys.
What were they calling you for?  Since they say that there was money that the state compensated the people, did you receive any money?
How did Phumzile's death affect your family?
We got so sick so much so that my mother suffered a stroke.

How did the stroke affect her, how was she after
UITENHAGE HEARING TRC/EASTERN CAPE
3 B PLAATJIES
the stroke?  Please take your time.  I would like to ask us to please keep quiet and show this witness the respect she deserves.
She was ill for a very long time, she is still not very well.
One last question.  What is your wish as a family, what is your request to this Commission?
I want some kind of memorial stone to be erected here in town.
Is that the only wish you have as a family?
Is there anything else that you would like to add before we conclude?
Thank you very much, I hand you back to the Chairperson, there might be more questions forthcoming.
